page.title: 19OLD HUTTON SCHOOL
page.content: {Old Hutton C.E.(Controlled) {School}was built in{1874}by{W. {Fawcett,}using{stone}from{Holmescales {Quarry.}(He built the{church}at the same time.) There was a{school}on the present site provided by{Mr.John {Milner}in{1639. Extensions}were made in{1902; prefabricated extensions}were used for the first time in{January {1966; further extensions}of the{infant {block}were{completed}in{1976}when a {kitchen}was also{added.}The number on roll has{decreased}by{20}in{seven {years}and the{expected}number of pupils in{September 1985}is{51 {children. {Some pupils live about four {miles}from the school and a{minibus does{two}runs{each morning and {afternoon. New Hutton School}was {closed about 1948. Children}from{New {Hutton}now attend{Old Hutton School.
